storyInfo: Lettou tries to persuade Golding to switch sides to the Defense Forces, along with the information she has on the Self-Salvation Corps. A Damazti approaches Golding, followed by Logos, who engages the Damazti in dialogue through drama.

attributes.content: What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I said as much, I'm here to enjoy the performance.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...Stay behind me, children.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I mean no offense, Lt. Colonel Lettou, but you're not welcome here.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: No need to be so distant, Golding.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I've always approved of your efforts. The more difficult the times, the more important education becomes.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You're speaking as though you have nothing to do with these 'difficult times.'
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: You're always finely dressed, aren't you? No matter what the times.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The only difference is you have more and more medals on your collar now.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Helping the Military Commission govern Londinium is not an easy job. I've encountered my share of... difficulties.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But my love for this city has never changed. I'm just like you, in that regard.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I'm sure Tom the cobbler agrees.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Tom is a friend too. The memory of that incident pains me.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: He got drunk and babbled something about 'His Majesty' and the 'Steam Knights.' He could hardy even spell 'Sarkaz.'
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: He's still alive.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Life is about more than simply being alive.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Are you accusing me of betraying Victoria, Golding?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I respect your courage, ladies.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: But you're mistaken.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I came here to take another look at this school. Nothing more.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: It's unfortunate that you seem to have forgotten me, Miss Molly.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Forgotten...?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I've spent just as much time here as you have. I even remember the children who came with you.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I was no longer so free, after my graduation from the military academy.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Golding, you trusted me once. We discussed the history of Gaul, the eternal pillars of literature—
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: That will do, Lt. Colonel Lettou.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I'm grateful to your father for sponsoring the school over the years. He made efforts to light the torch of wisdom, to drive out ignorance and chaos.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I once thought you like him. But you've extinguished the tiny spark with your own two hands.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Is that so, Golding? Why do you think the school has survived this long?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Why, you—don't even dare threaten us!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I have no reason to threaten you. Certainly not with the children around.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: We're all remnants of Gaul, Ms. Golding.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: We know the merciless devastation of war, the snuffing of countless lives, and the destruction of human progress towards wisdom.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I don't want Londinium to be the next Lingones, nor do I want to see the wonderful play that I just witnessed disappear forever.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: This is the burden that I have chosen to bear.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: ...I cannot endorse your views.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: The Royal Opera House of Lingones has long since been reduced to ash, but 'Ode au Triomphe' continues to be performed around the world.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Buildings fall and metal giants rust, but what we created within never dies. It's our knowledge, our culture, our hope.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: The darker the clouds of war, the more important it is that we hold onto our beliefs. Trust in beauty, and remind ourselves what separates us from the animals.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: You believe you can win a conflict like this?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: What you represent: fear, power, violence... these things can't keep everyone suppressed forever.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I must believe.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I can only believe.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: As long as there is light, we'll follow it.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I envy you then, Ms. Golding.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Look up at the dark clouds above you. A storm is coming.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: There is still time before the thunderbolt falls. We have a choice.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: I hope to see the conclusion of the play... someday.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: The Commander of the Defense Forces does not linger on the streets after leaving the school.
He came alone. There are none of his men in the vicinity.
She must find Adams and get the news out.
No matter how amicable the commander looked, there must be a reason why he came to the school.
Molly does not know, and neither do the children, but Golding does.
Why are there so many Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: The path to the bookstore is a familiar one. She has tread it countless times in the past two years.
But today, the path seems much longer than she remembers. She cannot see the end of it. She remembers the day that the Sarkaz came.
Can she truly change?
I must believe. I must...
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Fear seizes Golding by the throat.
She feels as though she is about to throw up. She turns and flees.
Lance! Patty!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The kids...! Nan—
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Nngh—!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: You need not have bothered yourself with a task as simple as this, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Then you should have arrested Ms. Golding, Lettou.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: It's what Manfred would have done. Old Red-Eye wouldn't have left a soul in the school alive.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We know you're not Sarkaz. You want to save one final shred of dignity for yourself, for the Defense Forces, for the people of the city.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: But we believe this is safer.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Lance, Patty... I hope the children are safe.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: I'm scared, Lt. Colonel. Scared that people like you and the Sarkaz may hurt the children. Scared that the children could grow up to be like you.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: You sound just like our unconscious guest here.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Yes... we're feeling.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: She cares about those young Victorians more than she cares about herself. We can feel it, but we find it difficult to understand, especially since it does not arise from ties of blood.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: ...Sir?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: We find you interesting. Through you, we understand ourselves... understand the Sarkaz better.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: You want answers? About what?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: You did not seem the kind of person to be curious about the Sarkaz, Lettou.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: My apologies, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: The mission always comes first.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: Take Miss Molly back, Lt. Colonel. Watch her closely. We will stay by Ms. Golding's side, and gather intelligence for the coming war.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: What's the matter, sir?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: Someone has discovered us.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: Should I call the men?
attributes.name: Lt. Colonel Lettou

attributes.content: No need. They can't stop him.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: He has learned much from Theresa. We will have an... interesting conversation.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: ...Molly.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Did anything happen while I was away?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: No. Lance and Patty were scared. Ralph and the older kids took the little ones to get some rest.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Good. I've been thinking... the children will enjoy the play, won't they?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Our hard work will mean something?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: No... nothing.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Don't mind the Commander of the Defense Forces, Ms. Golding.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I... I'm not feeling well. I need some rest.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Sorry, Molly. Could you clean up?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: There should be an end to the play. The Steam Knights arrived at the palace.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The children will perform the final scene in a few days, won't they?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: ...Absolutely.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: There sure are lots of possibilities, so long as the conclusion of the story hasn't yet been told.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: But even a play that's been performed can be changed. People always look for the latest.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: You've been watching for a long time, haven't you?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The stage is right here. Why don't we start from the beginning, from act one?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Everyone dreams about how things would have been, if none of this had happened.
'What ifs' mean nothing.
But if there is even a remote possibility...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Why don't you join us on stage, sir?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Good morning, sir! There is a look of concern on your face. Is something worrying you?
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: The horn of victory has blown atop the walls for three days and nights, but why do I feel uneasy?
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: Has our great general not returned triumphant? Praise his bravery and fearlessness!
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: Bravery? Fearlessness? Perhaps.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: A call to arms united our spirit, but the price was ruin and hate.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: You should have served a king, but you gave your loyalty to a thief.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: The mysterious spectator takes a step forward, his gaze moving from his counterpart to the distance.
He is not building up tension, but recalling memories of another battlefield, memories that have lain dormant for too long.
It is not a king that I serve, but honesty and courage.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: Destruction awaits, if you stay on this path.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: The destruction of the individual is nothing, compared to having to watch a tyrant bring this country to ruin.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: How do you know her end, sir?
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: I can predict her end, as I know her beginning.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: How could you reminiscence about the past, young as you are?
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: Who can keep the sun from setting? Such desires are the greatest greed.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: I have seen countless acts of madness performed in the name of preserving this glory. They turn to banditry, or fight amongst themselves, ultimately accelerating the decay of this country.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: 'Molly' turns around onstage, takes a few steps, then turns back, hiding her face in the shadows.
But her counterpart speaks first. His expression is calm, like water undisturbed. He shifts his hands, then crosses them.
They will not admit that those who fall try to cling to the sunlight, but grasp only lightning.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: Must they accept their fall?
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: They can choose to not look back at the peak.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: If they would turn their gaze around, they would realize that it is no abyss lying before them, but fertile earth in which infinite possibilities lie.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.content: You say the abyss can be conquered? You do not know the truth of the abyss, nor do you understand that time is short.
attributes.name: 'Molly'

attributes.content: The abyss lies before us. We can fill it with flesh, and burn the remnants with blood, leaving behind wide open fields for those who come after.
attributes.name: 'The Mysterious Spectator'

attributes.text: Only when the ashes of old are blown away can a new crop grow on the field, to feed the next generation.
